Package com.foreach.across.core.revision

Class RevisionBasedEntityManager<T extends RevisionBasedEntity<T>,U,R extends Revision<U>>

java.lang.Object
com.foreach.across.core.revision.RevisionBasedEntityManager<T,U,R>
public abstract class RevisionBasedEntityManager<T extends RevisionBasedEntity<T>,U,R extends Revision<U>> extends Object
Base class for revision based interaction of entities. Supports creating and updating drafts, making drafts final (checkin) and creating draft records based on an existing version (checkout).
Author:
Arne Vandamme

  • Constructor Details

    • RevisionBasedEntityManager

      protected RevisionBasedEntityManager()

    • RevisionBasedEntityManager

      protected RevisionBasedEntityManager(boolean allowRevisionModification)
      The single parameter of this constructor determines if it is allowed to modify entities for a specific revision. It is always allowed to modify a draft revision and possibly a special latest revision (with start and removal revision number of 0). Modifying a specific revision could impact all future revisions and can be considered a falsification of the history. In short, it's usually better not to allow it in which case an exception will be thrown when trying.
      Parameters:
      allowRevisionModification - True if modifying a specific revision is allowed.

    • getEntityForRevision

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public T getEntityForRevision(R revision)
      Returns the single entity for that revision.

    • getEntityForRevision

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public T getEntityForRevision(U owner, int revisionNumber)

    • getEntitiesForRevision

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public Collection<T> getEntitiesForRevision(R revision)
      Fetches the most applicable entities for a particular revision. In case the requested revision is a draft, either draft or latest checked in version might be returned, but only one of both.

    • getEntitiesForRevision

      @Transactional(readOnly=true) public Collection<T> getEntitiesForRevision(U owner, int revisionNumber)
      Fetches the most applicable entities for a particular revision. In case the requested revision is a draft, either draft or latest checked in version might be returned, but only one of both.

    • filterObsoleteEntities

      protected Collection<T> filterObsoleteEntities(Collection<T> candidates)
      Filters all entities from the collection that have been removed or updated by a corresponding draft record. Only the applicable draft records will be kept in that case.

    • saveEntityForRevision

      @Transactional public void saveEntityForRevision(T entity, R revision)

      This call expects a draft revision to be passed in, and will make all draft entities become active latest entities.

    • checkin

      @Transactional public void checkin(U owner, int revisionNumberToCheckin, int newRevisionNumber)
      This call expects a draft revision to be passed in, and will make all draft entities become active latest entities.

    • checkout

      @Transactional public Collection<T> checkout(R revision)
      Creates new draft records based on the revision specified. Any existing draft records will be removed or updated with the values from the specified revision.
      Parameters:
      revision - Revision that should serve as the base for the new draft.
      Returns:
      Collection of entities for the new draft revision.

    • checkout

      @Transactional public Collection<T> checkout(U owner, int revisionNumber)
      Creates new draft records based on the revision specified. Any existing draft records will be removed or updated with the values from the specified revision.
      Parameters:
      owner - Owner of the revision series.
      revisionNumber - Revision that should serve as the base for the new draft.
      Returns:
      Collection of entities for the new draft revision.

    • deleteEntities

      @Transactional public void deleteEntities(U owner)
      Deletes all entities (all revisions) for the owner.

    • deleteEntities

      @Transactional public void deleteEntities(R revision)
      Deletes all entities attached to the revision, usually a draft revision. This will only delete entities existing only in that revision. Entities starting before or ending after will be left kept.

      This means that even after a delete, you could get results if you ask for the revision number you just deleted.

    • deleteEntities

      @Transactional public void deleteEntities(U owner, int revisionNumber)
      Deletes all entities attached to the revision, usually a draft revision. This will only delete entities existing only in that revision. Entities starting before or ending after will be left kept.

      This means that even after a delete, you could get results if you ask for the revision number you just deleted.

    • checkinEntities

      protected void checkinEntities(Collection<T> items, int revisionNumber)
      This checks in all items in the collection: making all drafts existing in the revision specified, and all active ones stop existing in that revision.

    • convertToNewDtos

      protected Collection<T> convertToNewDtos(Collection<T> entitiesForRevision)
      Convert a collection of existing/attached instances to "create" dtos as if they are entirely new values. You must override this method to support specific revision checkouts.
      Parameters:
      entitiesForRevision - Collection of entities for a revision.
      Returns:
      Collection of dtos.

    • insert

      protected abstract void insert(T entity)
      Inserts a new entity in the data store.
      Parameters:
      entity - New entity instance that should be stored.

    • update

      protected abstract void update(T entity, int currentFirstRevision, int currentLastRevision)
      Updates the entity value with the current first and last revision in the datastore. The new value, first and last revision are set on the entity instance.
      Parameters:
      entity - New entity instance that should be stored.
      currentFirstRevision - Currently stored first revision.
      currentLastRevision - Currently stored last revision.

    • delete

      protected abstract void delete(T entity)
      Removes an entity from the data store.
      Parameters:
      entity - Entity instance that should be removed.

    • getAllForLatestRevision

      protected abstract Collection<T> getAllForLatestRevision(U owner)
      Returns:
      All entities relevant for the current/latest revision.
